website_summaries.verdict: Quite how LG has managed to cram so many features into the very affordable BD390 without compromising on performance is simply beyond us. We're not about to complain though

customer_reviews.title: After only 2 years and updates, plays Blu ray and DVDs intermittently (1/10 times).
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this unit in June 2009 and was very happy with it initially. I bought it based on the great reviews, but as you can see from the most recent ones, this model has not lived up to its 4 stars a short two years later. I kept the updates up-to-date (it is set up wirelessly), and like many others that have shared their feedback, started experiencing issues with playing discs a few months ago. We can still stream Netflix, but it's been frustrating hit-and-mixes with any blu ray or dvds. I expected to be able to get more from this player, so it has been disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: katana

customer_reviews.title: good blu ray player but wifi not so great
customer_reviews.text: This is a 4 year review of the product. The wifi for watching netflix was just ok and over the past years it was very sporadic and always seemed to be confused if it had a slow or fast connection so reloading all the time. So watching netflix was ok. The blu ray itself was very good. 4 years ago I paid $100 more for this unit. The technology has come so far from this player and they dont even have any updates in the past year for the software fixes. If you want to stream buy the new Roku 3 is AMAZING and FAST. DONT BUY THIS LG FOR THE WIFI.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Ability to reliably connect to Netflix streaming stopped
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this DVD player a little less than 2 years ago. I access the internet by wifi in my home. It played Netflix well initally then recently, after my warranty finished, Netflix connection problems (as well as UTube connection problems) are the norm and basically this unit is now just a BluRay player. I am sad to say that this is the second time a LG product I purchased died an early death. LG products seem to not have staying power. I connected a recently purchased Sony BluRay player with Netflix capabilities to the same TV and I have no Netflix connection problems.
customer_reviews.author: PowerShopper

customer_reviews.title: Good Network Blue Ray Player
customer_reviews.text: The Good: Integrated wi-fi, Netflix streaming, CinemaNow, YouTube. It instantly discovered my NetGear ReadyNAS that contains my media library. Plays DIVX, MPG, AVI movie files. The Bad: Sound sync issues with some movies such as "Watchmen", a future firmware update may resolve this problem. Wish List: Support for Amazon VOD, ability to browse Netflix "Play Now" titles directly and add them to queue. Overall Opinion: An easy to configure and use device. Recommended for anyone looking for a feature packed network blue ray player.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Excellent buy - works as promised
customer_reviews.text: I've been waiting for a blu-ray player that has Netflix capability with wi-fi, and this one delivers. It's relatively easy to set up, and quite straight-forward to use. The video quality on a 1080p screen is spectacular, and the ability to stream content from Netflix, without the hassle of running cables is what got me to buy this now, rather than wait for the inevitable price drops. If, like me, you're not tremendously tech-capable, allow a few hours to sort out all the set up. I had trouble getting the wi-fi to connect, but it all worked as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin M. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Good so far...
customer_reviews.text: I have used this for 3 days and so far so good. It is my first blue ray and I also really like how it can use my netflcks instant moves, much nicer then sitting at the small computer screen. I now have read the bad reviews and they scare me, but so far so good. (so far have used it about 5 hours every day.) I am looking at other blue ray players that can also stream the netflicks instant play movies. Just in case... *sigh* Keeping my fingers crossed. Other then the remote, so far I really like it. Will post after I have had it a few months to see how it does.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 LG dvd players. The bd3270 and the bd 390. The bd 370 works flawlessly, but the more expensive bd390 is a big disappointment. At first it wouldn't accept any software updates and it will not maintain the connectivity with the internet for streaming from Netflix and I have to set it up everytime I want Netflix. Now, it will not play many bluray dvds and that is unacceptable. The machine keeps shutting off when I insert a bluray dvd. I have none of these problems on the cheaper bd370 model.
customer_reviews.author: J. Jin

customer_reviews.title: Great Player at a low price
customer_reviews.text: I have been using it now for many years and it is good. The price was low as well, which is always a plus.
customer_reviews.author: R. Bitton

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: After my husband and I bought our first Blu-ray player, only to discover our TV was too old to have an HDMI port, we wondered if we'd be able to find anything with the older RCA hookups. This marvelous little player was the answer - and just in case we ever upgrade out TV, it also has HDMI port. We hadn't expected that it would also offer us Wi-Fi, that was a surprise bonus. We're totally delighted with this little player.
customer_reviews.author: Nexhmie

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't Be Happier
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for wi-fi connection capabilities and am in no way disappointed! Set-up was easy and firm ware updates are almost automatic with my wi-fi computer connection. Ease of use (I know, it's DVD player,how complicated can it be?)and superb picture/sound,even with 1940 B/W movies (ya'll should really watch the original 1940 British "Gaslight"). BTW, this replaced one segment of the really POS Sony S-Air home theater system I bought last April for $800, which, I now can't even "give away"!
customer_reviews.author: MikeD

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Fast delivery. Easy setup. Great menus and interface. Quick Netflix setup - movies look good streaming. Blue Ray has fast load times. Very happy overall! UPDATE: Exactly 13 months, almost to the day, after I bought this, it died. LG Customer Service would do nothing, except discount the shipping if I wanted to send it in for service. Really disappointed in the LG follow up. It was GREAT when I first got it. I guess I'd recommend if you only need one for 12 months.
customer_reviews.author: Rixator

customer_reviews.title: Dead. Life's good, but LG blue-ray not at all...
customer_reviews.text: After a year and a half, it just died, ironically just as "Secratariat" was coming around the back stretch on the first leg of the Triple Crown (via streaming Netflix). Unit wouldn't even power up. I did know he was going to win, but you get the idea : ) After a quick service call to LG, no love. Out of warranty, no service center nearby (initially she said it would be repaired for $70 including shipping until she typed in my zip code), so she said I'm on my own. Great. $300 doorstop or an overpriced, non-warranty service call. Worked fine until it didn't. I know how this horserace ends, too- no more LG products for me.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Waara

customer_reviews.title: Wireless Problems
customer_reviews.text: I had this connected through wireless the first night I got the unit. I could stream NetFlix and get YouTube content without a problem. After a few days however, both NetFlix and YouTube started complaining about "no network connection" (Netflix) or "Network Congestion" (YouTube). I verified that there actually IS a network connection. VUDU works fine. Tried to use CinemaNow and the unit actually powers itself OFF! Looks like this goes back to the vendor.
customer_reviews.author: Bill M.

customer_reviews.title: Worked good for the warranty
customer_reviews.text: This was the first blu ray I have purchased. It was great with dvd's and blu ray movies. I also liked that it had netflix and youtube on it. Three months after the warranty expired, the thing started freezing up after 45 minutes of play, and then quit playing altogether. Customer service was of no help. All of the network capabilities still function but the player won't read a disc (dvd or blu ray). It looks like I will be shopping for another player. Hopefully the next one will last longer than the warranty.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hendricks

customer_reviews.title: Love my LG BD 390 Blu-ray
customer_reviews.text: After my wife bugged me for over a year, I decided to get a Blu-ray player to go with my 65 inch t-v and Bose music system. WOW! What a difference it makes. Not only are the movies MUCH clearer, I love the instant movies I can get from Netflix. The LG 390 is perfect. It was easy to set up, easy to use, and works flawlessly . If I had to buy another one, there is no doubt I would buy this LG BD 390 again. This is the first LG product that I have ever owned, but it won't be the last.
customer_reviews.author: Dave S.

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Blu-ray Player
customer_reviews.text: This product delivered everything promised and more. Load time is excellent, picture and sound quality are outstanding, and Netflix operates well even on my wireless network. An unmatched combination of performance and features. One very minor complaint would involve the Netflix setup which wasn't entirely intuitive and for which LG customer service wasn't all that helpful. I finally thought through it and go it working on my own. Since then, no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: REG

customer_reviews.title: Great even if you don't plan to buy Blue-ray Disks
customer_reviews.text: I love this machine for these reasons: 1. It does Netflix streaming 2. It upconverts DVD's really well. 3. It plays Blue-ray 4. It is wireless or hardwire networking 5. It is fast for a Blue-ray machine I've owned it for a few weeks now. No complaints. It was easy to set up, it does updates when needed, and the picture is great. I own a couple of Blue-ray disks now, but mostly watch Netflix and upconverted DVD.
customer_reviews.author: Russ C

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work with some headphones
customer_reviews.text: Product was not compatible with my hearing assist device. So I never got to use it.
customer_reviews.author: dave

customer_reviews.title: DOPE SHOW !!!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first blu-ray player and after doing all my homework I decided that this was the best player on the market. My research served me well. The set up was simplistic and fast, but lets face it no electronic is difficult to set up now n days. The picture is amazing and the home page to access the netflix, youtube and other instant streaming video stores are easy to use and I have never had a glitch, freeze or any other annoying circumstances that have interfered with any play. If you are looking for a blu-ray player get this, it's worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Doogie

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup and awesome picture
customer_reviews.text: I am very impressed with this player. I had Netflix and Media Sharing up in going in under 30 minutes. Nero Media Home included with the player for sharing media from your PC worked without a hitch. I originally wanted to go with one of the cheaper Netflix blu-ray players, but I am glad I paid extra and got this one. I have my network connection wired so I can't speak for the wireless. I haven't seen any cons except for the high price, but you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: A. Russa

customer_reviews.title: Rocks!!
customer_reviews.text: The product is great - wireless networking is very useful too. Vudu/Netflix work flawlessly. The USB port can be used to connect even an iPod - however, due to the way Apple names the songs on the iPod (e.g., BQKV.MP3, AJUK.MP3, etc.) it makes it hard to to use with the device. Other flash devices where the names are human readable works just fine. If iPod support was better it would be the best player on the market!! Disc playback, upscaling are all good...
customer_reviews.author: S. Chari

customer_reviews.title: AMAZON SERVICE WONDERFUL.. L.G.SERVICE THE WORST SERVICE EVER.
customer_reviews.text: WE RECEIVED THE NEW L.G. BD390 BLU-RAY FASTER THAN EVEN PROMISED. THE REMOTE CONTROL WOULD NOT ALLOW US TO SET UP UNIT, SPOKE TO L.G. CUSTOMER SERVICE THREE TIMES, NOT ONLY THE REPS BUT ALSO A SUPERVISOR PROMISED A NEW REMOTE WITH IN 5 TO 7 BUSINESS DAYS. WE WAITED 29 DAYS NO REMOTE. WE WERE FORCED TO SEND THE TOTAL UNIT BACK TO AMAZON. REFUND WAS CREDITED IMMEDIATELY FROM AMAZON. AMAZON 100% RATING.. L.G. SERVICE TERRIBLE. THANK YOU AMAZON.
customer_reviews.author: SSGENO

customer_reviews.title: Blueray player
customer_reviews.text: The LG BD390 is an excellent blueray player. It is LG top of the line player with distint feachures. It has the ability to stream Netflix if you subcribe to them. Also the fact that it has a wireless connection to the internet is a big plus, no need to run an internet connection wire. I would buy this product again. The only drawback is that it is expensive. Before one buys this you might also consider buying a PS3 Slim for almost the same price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: not great
customer_reviews.text: It's not supported by LG anymore. It never worked that well. The youtube interface is terrible. It occasionally drops sound. And I sometimes get a glitch when playing DVDs. When working, it gives a good image, like all blu-ray players. I'm going to try a different brand when this unit dies or I get tired of its problems.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I'm very happy.
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I didn't rate it 5 stars is because of the design. The player works great and was SO easy to set up. This is my first blu-ray player. The design issue has to do with the tray you put the disc in. It is flimsy and I feel like I need to be real careful when inserting a disc but I am happy with everything else. The picture is incredible on my Sony XBR6 HDTV when watching a movie in blu-ray.
customer_reviews.author: bratkat90210

customer_reviews.title: A good blu ray player, with one caveat
customer_reviews.text: I received this player as a gift for fathers day(I'm Sara's dad). I am very satisfied with it, except for one area. The picture quality is great. Set up was easy and straight forward. Connecting it to my home theater system was simple. The remote is easy to use. However...the wireless internet connection does not work. I have fiber optic internet service, and use a D Link gaming router. The house is large, but anyone's laptop will work anywhere in the house. The dvd player will not recognize the internet signal. This wireless capability was one of the reasons this player was selected. So I would have to say that I am not satisfied with this feature.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: OutStanding
customer_reviews.text: This is probably the best DVD Blue Ray player on the market. Easily setup and streaming movies from the computer wireless and internet was a breeze. I only wish that the remote control had at least a on, off, and sound control for my LCD HDTV. The few TV's it will control is it's only down fall. Buying a multi-fuction remote is the only answer.
customer_reviews.author: Emelinda Willis

customer_reviews.title: LG BD 390 - Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I like how this BluRay player sets up quickly with no guessing involved. It's quick to load and spin up ready to play and gives a sharp clean image even to my regular DVDs. I use a HDMI cable to connect to my SamSung 42" LCD and basicly it's plug n play. The only part that seems to me a little flimsy is the disc tray, everything else is solid.
customer_reviews.author: Gene T. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great Blu-Ray player
customer_reviews.text: This is my first blu-ray player and I couldn't be more pleased. I am not at all technically adept but set up was very simple and straight forward. I had to get a new router and upgrade my ISP to take better advantage of Netflix and YouTube. With my faster router and more bandwidth, the picture quality for instant downloads from Netflix is very good as is YouTube. They also offer a pay per view service called CinemaNow which I don't use since I have Netflix. Discs load quickly and play very well, blu-ray disks, of course, are most clear and crisp. Amazon shipped very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Bosqueman

customer_reviews.title: Blue Horseshoe LOVES the LG BD390!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first Blu-ray player and I'm glad I waited and purchased this one. The picture quality is outstanding!! I wanted a player with wireless networking built-in and this is the only player I found that did not require an additional device (or external dongle). Over the past few weeks I have streamed content from Vudu, Netflix, and YouTube and it worked flawlessly and with ease. FYI - The slide out tray that holds the disk seems flimsy compared to my other disk drives, but I think it will be okay. My only disappointment is with the remote which is not compatible with my Panasonic TC-P50S1 Plamsa TV.
customer_reviews.author: Blue Horseshoe

customer_reviews.title: No problems, very happy
customer_reviews.text: I don't have experience with picture or sound quality of other blu-ray players, but it did not seem like there were any short comings when playing blu-ray discs. I chose this for the wireless Netflix capability and figured I would upgrade to blu-ray discs from Netflix at the same time. The setup was easy. I was a little worried b/c my wireless network did not show up on the available list, but I manually entered the name and security (WP2) code and a minute later I could watch a movie. Obviously streaming quality depends on wireless quality, we did not have any interruptions. I am using an Apple Airport Express for wireless.
customer_reviews.author: Cory

customer_reviews.title: Excellent feature set - intermittent sound problem
customer_reviews.text: This is my first blu-ray player, so I won't try to compare its picture or sound or even delay performance to other players. I will say that the picture quality blew me away when I put in my first blu-ray disc (Blade Runner, natch). The main reason for this review is to note a problem I've been having with the unit. Intermittently, when starting play back of any kind using HDMI/1080p (whether from the disc, or from Vudu, or from Netflix) there will be no sound. If I stop the playback and restart, it plays fine, starting from where I left off. This looks like a software issue; I'm running the latest update at the moment, -527B.
customer_reviews.author: J. Zimmerman

customer_reviews.title: Great 1080P picture, but...
customer_reviews.text: The first one I ordered refused to power up. Amazon's return service is fantastic. A replacement was on the way before I could ship the defective item back. The Blu-ray picture is excellent. I have the new one set up to stream Netflix with my Wi-Fi. The player occasionally forgets my Wi-Fi settings. I'm on a 3Mb DSL service; not fast enough to stream hi-def media, but the other stuff looks pretty good. Over all, I'm pleased with the purchase. UPDATE: This thing died for good about a year later. It's junk. Stay away from this model even if you find it cheap. I went with a Sony Blu-ray and 20Mb cable modem. Very happy with both.
customer_reviews.author: Tango Mike

customer_reviews.title: Stay away from LG Blu-Ray players
customer_reviews.text: I've had 4 LG BLu-Ray players now THe BD300, two BD370s and the BD390. Two of the 4 players have failed just after 1 year of use. LG's policy is to charge the customer 69 dollars for sending it back and then any parts for the repair. I've owned VCRs; LaserDisc, DVD and many other similar brands of consumer electronics and have never has as much trouble or received as little customer service and appreciation for brand loyalty as I have for the LG products. Just a warning for all of you who are interested in Blu-Ray players, based on my experience, stear clear of LG.
customer_reviews.author: R. Jarrett

customer_reviews.title: Blu-ray player that won't
customer_reviews.text: This player has always been a bit picky about the Blu-ray disks it will play, but after 2 1/2 years it has pretty much given up on them. It will still play DVDs, but I didn't spend $300 on this thing to play DVDs, and I'm quite done sending disks back to Netflix unwatched. I've ordered a 3D Panasonic model, and I'll be adding the LG to the recycle pile where it belongs.
customer_reviews.author: E. Leckert

customer_reviews.title: Love the player only one draw back does not support ...
customer_reviews.text: Love the player only one draw back does not support amazon prime .Tried evey way to get software to do this but was told by LG that they could write program to do this find that hard to believe
customer_reviews.author: gregory a crawford

customer_reviews.title: Another DOA
customer_reviews.text: I should have payed attention to the poor quality reviews by other posters. The feature set is great, but, when it won't even power up new out of the box, LG needs to work on their overall quality. When I was in high school in the 70s, LG called themselves Lucky Goldstar. Lucky Goldstar was known for producing absolute crap. I've never purchased anything from them until now. It appears that they changed the name, but, not the product.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas A. Cain

customer_reviews.title: Streaming
customer_reviews.text: The wired Internet connection was not that good and the wireless WiFi connection was down-right lousy.
customer_reviews.author: Dave DeGrenier

customer_reviews.title: Great Player, Easy Wireless Set-up
customer_reviews.text: Took this unit out of the box, plugged it into my TV. Powered it up, and went through the easy, relatively short menu to set it up, including getting it to talk on my wireless network. My network needs to be set up more thoroughly (our original computer - the 'server'- has died and we haven't quite figured out how to get the new one designated as the server), so I haven't been able to stream stuff from my computer yet, but YouTube is readily available. Most importantly, it sends a GREAT image to my TV. I only have a 1080i unit at the moment (1080p coming soon!), but the Planet Earth BluRay DVDs are incredible!
customer_reviews.author: Ronald L. Constable

customer_reviews.title: Incredible Product
customer_reviews.text: LG BD 390 works like a charm. Does things I would never thought possible just a few years ago. Watch Netflix with built in wireless connection or view pictures that are on your computer but now watch them on HD big screen TV. Plus picture quality is fantastic. Best toy I've bought since my iMac. PAB
customer_reviews.author: PAB

customer_reviews.title: Issues with Win 7
customer_reviews.text: the player plays Blu-ray just fine, Netflix is great. Problem I have is streaming from my media servers. They are both running Windows 7 and the shares do not work on either. As a test, I tried it on an old XP box I had and that works fine streaming movies. I spoke with their helpdesk and suffice it to say they are not aware of any issues with Win 7, but then they were not aware of very much at all. Has anyone gotten it to work streaming from Win 7 shares?
customer_reviews.author: Victor Cserer

customer_reviews.title: LG BD 390 Network Blu-Ray Player
customer_reviews.text: Very nice product. Extremely easy to set up; basically, plug and play. Open box, connect cables, set TV mode to reflect your BluRay connection (i.e., HDMI,Component, etc.) , turn on unit, insert disc, sit back and watch your movie. No kidding . . . just doesn't get any more simpler than that. Haven't tried the Netflix streaming yet and haven't had the unit long enough to comment on it's reliability, but functionally speaking, it works out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: qtoyou

customer_reviews.title: Worthless wireless
customer_reviews.text: As a DVD player & blu ray it works great. But wireless connection is worthless. It cannot find my Netgear WPN824 router most of the time. When it does connect with the router (about 20% of the time) it works great for Netflix streaming. The router is just on the other side of the wall. The signal is strong (Tivo right next to the LG player records 80% - 90% signal strength.) I did have an unrelated question during set up and talked to a helpful, courteous LG person. If you cannot hard wire the network connection then don't bother.
customer_reviews.author: N. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Won't even turn on!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product in early August and sent to work in a remorte place for a few months and got back to try out my new blu-ray player and it will not even turn on. Now I have to try to figure out why the player will not operate correctly! LG customer service is a waste of time and did not help me out at all. By a different brand people, do not waste your time!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher J. Olson

customer_reviews.title: Great blu-ray player with lots of features
customer_reviews.text: I've really been enjoying this blu-ray player, especially using it in conjunction with Tversity to stream media from my PC. It handles file streaming beautifully, except it can't seem to handle Hulu. The blu-ray player itself is speedy and the remote is simple and pretty intuitive. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: nerwen15

customer_reviews.title: LG works great-loving the NETFLIX streaming downloads!
customer_reviews.text: LG BD 390 Network Blu-ray Disc Player: It was delivered within 48 hours with regular shipping. The setup went smoothly. I wound up using a HDMI cable [...]. Love NETFLIX streaming video!! FYI:Somehow I did miss that it requires not just FIOS hookup to download NETFLIX but a direct /or WIFI internet connection. Once that was corrected everything was plug and play.
customer_reviews.author: Rosemary Ciotti

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite player
customer_reviews.text: Everything works as advertised. Easy to operate and setup. The best part is the ability to access media from my desktop wireless-ly thru my router. I hooked it up through my receiver and the surround sound is crystal clear. My home theater is a family fav. Does not play .wmv files for me and that is my only neg comment.
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: Great Player
customer_reviews.text: This was my first Blu-Ray player and I am real impressed. The picture quality is much, much better than regular DVD and it was very easy to set up. It has wireless network (802.11n) built in and it was easy to set up. Great Blu-Ray Player!!!
customer_reviews.author: Gordon J. Balbach

customer_reviews.title: LG BD 390 Blu-ray Player
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful blu-ray player. It has wireless capability to stream movies, and access U-Tube. Picture quality and sound are fantastic! Definitely recommend this product. Amazon.com had a great price, as well, plus free shipping. The product arrived very quickly - before the estimated delivery date. Will defintely buy more at Amazon.com.
customer_reviews.author: Deb, VA

customer_reviews.title: I love this Bl-Ray Player
customer_reviews.text: The description doesn't say it streams VUDU, however as soon as you plug it in, update the software on the player and it will load. I love all the streaming content (well VUDU and Netflix). Haven't set up the connection to my PC. Wi-Fi is a nice touch. I have a feeling the Blu-Ray will be obsolete pretty soon, but the streaming content is mind blowing quality and value. Although in a side by side comparison to a Roku, I would pick the Roku.
customer_reviews.author: Brian R. Foxworthy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Blu-ray
customer_reviews.text: We really researched various manufacturers and viewed lots of reviews before we made this purchase. We bought a 40" Samsung and was going to buy a samsung player but in the end after reviewing all options and consumer reviews we opted for the LG390. It was easy to add the firmware right out of the box it required one but there has been no problems and has worked flawlwssly since november'99. We have watched vodu downloaded movies and netfilx and you tube segments and we have verizon fios and content has come thru just fine. Am very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Richard J. Schlup

customer_reviews.title: Great player!
customer_reviews.text: This blue ray player is absolutely great. It is very easy to set up. Netflix works great. The youtube function works flawless. If you have a wireless G router, it works better. We have both a g and a n, and ironically the g works faster. The n works faster on our laptop, though. We bought this player for $280.25 and it's worth a whole lot more. No regrets. Remote is fine, is simple and works great. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: nicks350

customer_reviews.title: Loved it... Till the warranty expired
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this Bluray player, but 16 months after I bought it, the disc drive stopped playing DVDs or Bluray discs. Bluray discs are ejected ("check disc" error), and DVDs are just not recognized as even inserted ("no disc" error). I'll see if I can clean it or find a software solution.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Cormier

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I spent many hours researching my Blu-Ray options before settling on the LG. I really appreciated the written materials that came with the LG, and output is exceptional. Easy to install, especially when you use HDMI cable (get Monster 12 color).
customer_reviews.author: J. M. Cohen

customer_reviews.title: Wont play BD or DVD anymore
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for about 1.5 years - the last patch or download completely eliminated any ability to either play Bd's or DVDs - it's disgraceful and horrid action by LG - who now claim the player is not supported anymore. I won't recommend anyone buying an LG Bd player again if this is the way they treat customers - even the PS3 gets regular patch updates and plays everything perfectly to this day. Shame on LG - it's a real pity because the picture quality and sound really were excellent.
customer_reviews.author: JW Pepper

customer_reviews.title: stopped playing sound after a few months! Networking not good!
customer_reviews.text: THIS PLAYER STOPPED PLAYING SOUND AFTER A FEW MONTHS. IT ALSO DOES NOT WORK WITH MOST NETWORK SECURITY. WEP IS THE ONLY ONE THAT WORKS. WIRELESS SIGNAL WITH N BAND ROUTER ONLY 15 FEET AWAY HAS 1 BAR AND DOES NOT STREAM WELL AT ALL! WHAT A PIECE OF JUNK!!! DO NOT WAIST YOUR TIME! CALLED LG CUSTOMER SUPPORT AND THEY WILL NOT HELP AT ALL! BEWARE LG ONLY HAS A LABOR WARRANTY OF 3 MONTHS! THEN YOU ARE ON YOUR OWN WITH THIS JUNK PLAYER!!!
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Russell

customer_reviews.title: Great equipment
customer_reviews.text: I originally thought that the My Media feature would only work with Windows, but I was pointed in the direction of TwonkyMedia and it works great with Linux and Mac (I tried both!) - so I don't have to have any Microsoft rubbish in my house! So This product is perfect ;-)
customer_reviews.author: Caoimhin Breidenbach

customer_reviews.title: Failed Unit
customer_reviews.text: I got the unit, it worked great for 3 months, and then failed. The firmware update caused the system to crash. 69 dollars for labor (as only parts are covered for a year) to fix it. I would not recommend this unit to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Good unit but DVD function stopped working
customer_reviews.text: This was a great unit for about 6 months, at which point the DVD function stopped working. Blu-Ray and Netflix were unaffected. We tried contacting LG customer support but they could not offer a solution for us.
customer_reviews.author: nostalgia88

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: Many of the reviews on this product mention poor quality and I am no different. The unit quit working 11 and 1/2 months into owning it. "No loader found" was the error message which meant that the disk tray would not open. Now I have to take apart the unit to get my disk back. It's technically still under warranty for the parts but labor is only 90 days and they want $70 to fix the unit. Not good.... No more LG electronics for me.
customer_reviews.author: D. Voss

customer_reviews.title: Nice starter
customer_reviews.text: First review i've done here but had to speak out .. Did a lot of research into these lil machines and i can safely say this one came highly reccomended.. Rightfully so ... Very easy to set/hook up .. Very fast load time and superb picture quality .. Upconvert is also very good quality ...Havent tried the online stuff as yet but for the money , you cant go wrong with this gem
customer_reviews.author: Neal Sasser

customer_reviews.title: Works Like a Charm
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm "out of the box". Don't know why some have complained about the lack of an eject button there is one on mine (top right of machine), .This is a good heavy streamlined machine. Yes, a bit pricey but I think it is well worth the investment. Have also noted complaints about the location of the power on/off button (top left of machine). If it is too much trouble to reach over to it merely use the furnished remote controller. Same goes for the disk eject/open button, use the remote if you can't stretch your arm. Geeeeesh, some people are fussy (lazy?)
customer_reviews.author: Russell P. Berg

customer_reviews.title: Great product and very reliable
customer_reviews.text: Been using this product for about 3 years with no problems, It has great picture quality and easy to use. I finally got a 3D TV and wanted to watch 3D moves so I sold it and replace it with the LG BD620 3D Blu-Ray Player.
customer_reviews.author: Melvin

customer_reviews.title: Just about perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is an incredible player. Easy setup, fast disc loading, flawless playback. The netflix streaming is great, I haven't tried Vudu or CinemaNow, but those are great options. I have been able to stream all kinds of video files from my PC. This is several devices in one. The only thing I don't like is that when I pause a disc, the player turns itself off after just a few minutes, and blu ray discs lose their place after power shutoff. There does not seem to be a way to adjust this power save feature. Otherwise this is an easy recommend.
customer_reviews.author: A. Alvarado

customer_reviews.title: Great Blu-ray player!  Worth the little extra $
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for a while for a good wireless network blu-ray player, and LG gave it to me! The fact that I don't have to have another wire to hook-up,or hanging out was a seller. This blu-ray player was a breeze to set-up as well. I've read other reviews of other players, and this was clearly the right choice. I would recomend this player to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Ari Litwack

customer_reviews.title: Out OF The Box and Streaming Netflix In Less Than 2 minutes
customer_reviews.text: Read many reviews. CNET AND GIZMODO Bought the amazon warehouse discounted version. "Blemishes on box" I'm not kidding, without reading the manual I had it connected to my wireless and streaming Netflix "Bart Got A Room" in less than two minutes. What more can you ask? I'm not a networking guru. Far from it. It's as easy as walking into a room with your Iphone and entering the wireless password. Anyway - reliability? Have had it for about two hours! Loving it. [...]
customer_reviews.author: Professor Scotty

customer_reviews.title: Great Product. Better than ..... Best yet seen.
customer_reviews.text: This gadget does what it claims to do. Set up was quick: 2 mins after connecting I was watching a movie via Netflix. I browsed and watched movies on YouTube. I haven't tried the wireless setup yet but I believed it will be a breeze. The quality of the pictures and movies were unsurpassed. The load time for discs, for both Blu-Rays and normal DVDs is the fastest I've seen yet. (Let me know if there is a faster one). In all, its a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Kobby

customer_reviews.title: Works on My Mac Network.
customer_reviews.text: After reading some reviews here, I almost didn't purchase this great player, but I'm glad that I ignored the few reviewers that said that the wireless connection didn't work with a Mac. Well. . . it works extremely well with my Mac/Airport (Extreme). I was up and running in minutes. The network, Netflix, and YouTube were all set up and configured easily.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: The first time I plugged it in, it gave an error and wouldn't fire up the laser. Called support and worked with them, but couldn't get it fixed. Got a RA for warranty and quit that day. Next day it fired up and has been fine since. Shipping? The product has been great with netflix and has outstanding picture quality. Tech support was good and no hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Dale L. Rollins

customer_reviews.title: Broke in 12 months!! Garbage!!!
customer_reviews.text: What a piece of junk! Paid $300 for this LG BD-390 and it lasted 12 months. How convenient the warranty is also 12 months??? Will never buy LG again. AVOID!!!
customer_reviews.author: rdemaio

customer_reviews.title: Probably The Best Network Blu-Ray Player You Can Buy.
customer_reviews.text: During the short period that I have had this player and I'm very pleased with its performance. Its was very easy to setup to the internet through my Netgear WNDR3700 Dual Band Wireless Router. The Blu-ray and DVD playback on my 37" LG 37LH40 was excellent. Picture quality streaming of the content from Netflix and Youtube was very good. Having Vudu and Cinemanow is also a great added benefit to other choices for movie selections.
customer_reviews.author: Darrell E. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great Blu-Ray player with all the bells and whistles!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great player out of the box. Everything worked great for me right away. It plays Blu-Rays as expected, upconverts DVD's and with a network connection it streams from Netflix, CinemaNow, and your home network. I didn't try or use wireless, my home is wired, so I can't comment on wireless. With the latest firmware it is even better, and there as a due-any-minute firmware update coming that will add Vudu streaming also. All in all, one of the best Blu-Ray players in the current crop of network enabled players.
customer_reviews.author: T. Hesselman

customer_reviews.title: Piece of Junk
customer_reviews.text: Very poor streaming device. Will not hold a signal, will not hold the settings, will not hold the device code. Have to reset or recode more often than not, and this at a distance of only 30 feet from the wireless N router. I'm now using a different streaming device for NetFlix streaming which works just fine. Sorry I bought this player. Very expensive device for just playing blu ray discs.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: This LG BR player is tops; great picture/sound quality, easy setup, cool interface, all together well worth the money. It integrates nicely with my LG plasma.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bad product, stopped working after a year.
customer_reviews.text: This product worked well for a year and then stopped playing DVDs and BlueRays. The only thing, I could do with it is streaming netflix. Even the firmware is not updated. So effectively this is a junk product for the price. I would strongly avoid buying bluerays in LG series.
customer_reviews.author: PAS

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I never watch anything other than Blu-Ray and this is a great player. I have watched 1,000 plus movies on it
customer_reviews.author: montanacruiser

customer_reviews.title: LG D 390
customer_reviews.text: This model was recomended by a friend who had used it for quite some time. His had worked out well so I decided to go ahead and purchase one. Glad I did.
customer_reviews.author: Bill from AZ

customer_reviews.title: LG BR390 Network Blu-Ray Disc Player
customer_reviews.text: I first purchased a Samsung Blu-Ray Disc Player, but could not get it to work with the LG HDTV I had using HDMI input. I tried 3 different cables. The Samsung player would flash white noise on the screen and restart the video. I tried the Samsung player on a friends Sony HDTV and it worked fine with all 3 cables. I talked to LG and Samsung technical support and got no where. I purchased the LG BR390 and problem solved. I really like the picture quality better too.
customer_reviews.author: William M. Hostettler

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Player
customer_reviews.text: This player does it all. I love the ability to watch instant movies from Netflix or watch movies from my media library. Nearly everything I've thrown at it has played. DVDs look fantastic on it and Blu Ray discs look awesome as well. The fast startup time and fast read time of discs and media make it enjoyable to use and the wifi access keeps me from having to have more cables than necessary. All-in-all a fantastic machine!
customer_reviews.author: Paulke

customer_reviews.title: LG BluRay Disc Play
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful product. We love this disc playerer. The pictures on our tv are beautiful It was very easy to hook up and use.
customer_reviews.author: Sue E. Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: LG BD390
customer_reviews.text: The LG BD 390 is touted as a Blue Ray Player with wireless connection to the internet to allow downloading of NetFlix movies. It turned out to be an attractive unit which functions exactly as advertised. With my DSL connection the downloaded movies are not as clear as movies on DVD or Blue Ray Disc but they are acceptable - and unlimited in quantity. It would probably be better with a cable connection. However, the unit is great. It also allows download and viewing of YouTube clips as well as other stuff I don't use.
customer_reviews.author: RobertP

customer_reviews.title: Dependability?
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this unit in October of 2009, it died in the end of October 2010. RIP. Low usage, network connectivity wireless did not work effectively. Called a nice guy in customer service that essentially told me that I was hosed. I would not buy LG after this.
customer_reviews.author: Havasuvian

customer_reviews.title: Super BluRay Player
customer_reviews.text: Great picture and sound. Lightening fast loading. Automatic firmware updates. The fast loading makes it worth it over other brands. Easy setup. Plug and play (almost). The only minor problem I have is that I have to route the HDMI through my amp to get certain sound types. Would have preferred to route the HDMI to my monitor and a separate cable to my amps digital input.
customer_reviews.author: Home Movie Buff

customer_reviews.title: I liked BD390 - AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: I liked BD390. Everything is working except media server. Wireless, Netflix, Youtube... I am pretty happy with the product. Did anyone experience any problem with Nero installation?
customer_reviews.author: S. Pal

customer_reviews.title: Won't play many newer discs or Netflix discs
customer_reviews.text: Look elsewhere if you are a Netflix customer. Not only will it repeatedly disconnect itself from your Netflix account it won't play many rental discs. After a recent Firmware update the player balks at many newer discs from Netflix. LG has no customer server mechanism to resolve this and since and has abandoned support for it's players. Not worth the frustration.
customer_reviews.author: Prag

customer_reviews.title: Easy Setup and Great Performance
customer_reviews.text: The unit fires up quickly and immediately brings me to the home screen if there is no DVD present and away I go streaming from Netflix, the disappointing Cinemanow and surprising Vudu service. Curious as to why no Amazon VOD on this unit but it works precisely as advertised and is easy enough for my wife to operate.
customer_reviews.author: Conrad J Wredberg

customer_reviews.title: Wireless and Wired Netflix
customer_reviews.text: Had some initial problems with Netflix streaming but both the wireless and wired Netflix streaming worked good after updating the software for my network router. The LG helpline told me that my D-Link router needed to have the software updated to work with this blueray player.
customer_reviews.author: Kitchen Helper

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied Customer
customer_reviews.text: To date this has performed flawlessly. Very easy to setup. Netflix streaming does need a G or N router. A wireless connection works fairly well but an ethernet (wired) connection for streaming movies is best. Would not hesitate to recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Ron E.

customer_reviews.title: 90 day warranty, died in 6 months
customer_reviews.text: Like many other people, my unit died after 6 months. The cheap disc unit won't read any disc. I'll pay more attention to the warranty next time. Will never buy from LG again.
customer_reviews.author: vahighland

customer_reviews.title: Bluray
customer_reviews.text: I am very satisfied with this purchase. I did a lot of research before I bought it and the research that has come out since supports my choice.It has offered good performance and previous experience with LG customer service has been excellent.A great item for people with reasonable expectations.
customer_reviews.author: ohmy

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding DVD
customer_reviews.text: The LG performs as advertised. I bought this model for the features it offers. The wireless internet works without any problems. I have had no problems and works flawlessly. The picture quality from this unit is outstanding. CNet rated this unit high, and it is performing and functioning as reviewed. You can not go wrong for the price and the overall features.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Gomez

customer_reviews.title: Delivers as promised
customer_reviews.text: Ordered my LG BD390 from Amazon.com and received it in 3 days. Setup was simple as I opted to use HDMI and connected to my LG 60PG60 Plasma Flat Screen. Decided to try the wireless to my uverse Home Gateway. I was astonished how easy the whole setup was. Connected to Netflix and have been streaming movies ever since. This product is a must buy in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Martin M. Tereyla

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: We love this machine. It was so easy to set up and works beautifully. I am no techie, but by following the instructions, we were in business in no more than ten minutes. And the Netflix streaming has been great! What a convenient way to watch our Netflix movies. And it works well every time.
customer_reviews.author: Frank C. Vaughn

customer_reviews.title: Great Blu-ray Player....
customer_reviews.text: A Great operating unit. Up converts DVD to 1080P format. Has all the whistles and bells. Is setup to receive Netflix and many other sides. Easy to use and operate.
customer_reviews.author: Carter E. Loftis Jr.

customer_reviews.title: LG BD 390 Player
customer_reviews.text: Product works well and has reasonable load times. Link to internet is useful for YouTube and Movie Downloads. It is highly recommended that you download and install the latest software patch from the menu built into the player. Product will hold the Video output setting upon shut down and restarting, which is useful for some TV systems.
customer_reviews.author: Paul B. Tillman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent DVD Player
customer_reviews.text: LG BD 390 easily beats competition at this stage of combining Blu-Ray DVD player with broadband capabilities. It is wireless, with one of the highest (type "n") speeds. Besides, sophisticated circuitry of the player allows for better processing of Netflix and other internet widgets.
customer_reviews.author: Rigor

customer_reviews.title: Not there just yet
customer_reviews.text: Good: 1. Video quality in both HD and SD is great 2. Netflix feature is terrific 3. Being able to browse picture right from your PC is great Bad: 1. Video and Audio is out of sync on 3 out of 4 Blue Ray movies I watched 2. Audio quality is questionable when hooked up directly to TV 3. Playing video files from PC is extremely slow and unstable I think technology is not there yet. I am returning it to Amazon mainly due to video-audio sync issue
customer_reviews.author: V. Gotovsky

customer_reviews.title: Amazon ships unit without packaging--caution
customer_reviews.text: Just a quick note on Amazon's shipping. I just received my unit today through UPS. Arrived in perfect condition, but they ship it with just the manufacturer's packaging. If you live in a neighborhood where it might get stolen because anyone seeing it will know what it is, be careful.
customer_reviews.author: C. Jacobsen

customer_reviews.title: Must have Blu Ray
customer_reviews.text: Looking at the evolution of the video industry,streaming video does seem to be a natural progression. Therefore, a Blu-ray player with WiFi is money well spent to get a bit ahead of the curve. Already many videos are streaming and this LG player is first class in viewing quality, at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph R. Recht

customer_reviews.title: broke down after 6 months... $70 + shipping for service...
customer_reviews.text: For the amount of money this thing cost... I would actually expect some decent quality... the unit stopped reading blu ray disks after 6 months... normal DVDs are played at will (more often not played). Customer support... suggested shipping it back at my own expense and pay $70 to service it. The first and the last time I am buying LG.
customer_reviews.author: Ari

product_meta.title: LG BD 390 Network Blu-ray Disc Player (2009 Model)
product_meta.description:
Blu-ray Disc Player w/1GB Memory, 7.1 discrete analog output, BD-P, Netflix HD, YouTube, CinemaNow Full HD 1080P Output via HDMI, DVD 1080p Up-conversion.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
 LG BD390 (August 17, 2009)
It’s time to expect more from a Blu-ray player than just stunning Full HD 1080p. Way more. Feast your eyes on the first LG Network Blu-ray Disc Player with both NetCast Entertainment Access and Integrated Wi-Fi Connectivity. That means thousands of movies, shows and online videos straight to your TV from any wireless Internet connection. Streaming entertainment services like CinemaNow, Netflix and YouTube are at your fingertips, whenever you want them. LG BD390 has virtually endless entertainment built-in and it can be tapped into from any available Wi-Fi connection. 


FEATURES AND TECHNOLOGY

Less Clutter. More Possibilities.
Cut loose from messy wires. Integrated Wi-Fi Connectivity lets you tap into BD390’s streaming services from the Internet almost anywhere you have a Wi-Fi connection. (Learn more)

Entertainment On Tap
The end of “there’s nothing on”. NetCast Entertainment Access lets you stream instant, and virtually endless, entertainment from CinemaNow, Netflix and YouTube. It’s direct to your TV from the Internet—no computer required. (Learn more)

Enjoy It At Its Best
Why would you want anything but the best picture possible? Make the most of your HDTV. Blu-ray disc playback delivers exceptional Full HD 1080p video and audio performance. (Learn more)

Making Old Just Like New
No need to go out and replace your old DVD collection. Even your standard DVDs look better on Blu-ray with Standard DVD Up-Scaling.(Learn more)

Capture The Silver Screen
Ever wish movies looked more like they do in the theater? Wish no more. With Cinema Mode, you can watch movies the way they are meant to be seen. (Learn more)

Don’t Just Hear It. Feel It.
Great picture needs great sound. Blu-ray’s superior audio performance lets you listen in Full HD and supports up to 7.1 channels of surround sound in the latest formats. (Learn more)

No More Waiting To Watch
When you’ve decided on a movie, you don’t want to sit around waiting for it to load. Express Reaction Startup eliminates annoying load times. (Learn more)

Your Personal Favorites 
It’s time to bring your favorite music files, digital photos, and videos from your computer straight to your TV. With MyMedia, it’s easy. (Learn more)

Memories On The Big Screen
Want to view a highlight reel of your family vacation in the comfort of your living room? You can with USB 2.0 Media Plus. (Learn more)

Get More From Your Movies
Want to hear real time commentary from your favorite movie director? You could do that, and a lot more, with BD Live. (Learn more)




LEARN MORE

Integrated Wireless Connectivity
Convenient connectivity to your wireless home network allows BD390 to deliver you NetCast Entertainment Access and BD Live features, even in rooms where broadband connections can’t reach. All you need is an active Wi-Fi signal—it’s that simple.




Netcast Entertainment
Now buying a Blu-ray player from LG can also mean getting access to virtually endless entertainment and services from the Internet. Want to watch your favorite action film? If you have an LG Network Blu-ray Disc Player with NetCast Entertainment Access and an Internet connection, select an onscreen service and you’ll be enjoying it in moments. Tapping into virtually endless entertainment from the Internet no longer requires a computer or messy wires. This is the future of entertainment, and it’s available now with LG.
Cinema Now
Now Hollywood’s latest hits can be viewed any time you want. With CinemaNow, LG consumers can get instant access to pay-per-view movies from major studios directly to any LG Network Blu-ray Disc Player. Find major release titles, along with broadcast and cable television programs. The entire premium content catalog can be browsed directly and selections can be watched instantly. CinemaNow and LG have redefined what can be expected of digitally available entertainment. Netflix: Unlimited Viewing
Make the most of the extensive offerings on Netflix. Users with a subscription can sit back and enjoy unlimited instant access to over 12,000 Netflix movies and TV episodes* streamed directly to their TV set. Most movies and TV episodes appear in standard definition and many selections are not new releases.
*Netflix subscription required and sold separately.

YouTube
Now you can watch everything on YouTube right in your living room. Blu-ray players with NetCast give you unlimited, direct access to the millions of Web videos available through YouTube, whenever you want them. All you need is an active Internet connection. Watch that one fellow making a fool of himself over and over again.






The Best Picture
This next generation optical disc format brings you the highest Full HD 1080p experience. That means it allows you to get the best picture quality available from your HDTV and even improves old DVDs with 1080p Up-Scaling, improving standard DVD picture quality so they look their best in Full HD.


The Best Capabilities
Blu-ray utilizes the latest laser technology, offering up to 5 times the digital capacity of traditional DVDs. More space means more room for cool features and extra content.




Standard DVD Up-Scaling
It’s not just Blu-ray discs that look great on a Blu-ray player. Standard DVD Up-Scaling delivers exceptional image quality from standard DVDs to near full HD picture quality. That means even your older movies and shows look better on an LG Blu-ray player.




Cinema Mode
Stay in for the theater. Enjoy a true cinema-like experience in your own home with movies the way they are meant to be seen. LG’s Cinema Mode precisely displays 24p source frames on your screen, the same as on a movie screen. If you love movies, you’ll love LG’s Cinema Mode.





Superior Audio Performance
Blu-ray lets you enjoy the best sound available from your movies and shows. Supports surround sound up to 7.1 channels with Dolby Digital Plus, Dolby TrueHD and dts-HD Advanced Digital Out technologies.




Express Reaction Startup
Some Blu-ray players can take what seems like an eternity to load your Blu-ray disc. With Express Reaction Startup, the quick start-up and quick opening tray will have your movie loaded and ready to play before you even hit the couch.




MyMedia
Gives you access to videos, photos and music from your home network through this DLNA-certified media player. Your digital collections are now within easy reach and simple to view in the comfort of your living room.




USB 2.0 Media Plus
Bring your digital library to life on your television with USB Media Plus. View family photos, watch videos and listen to music from USB storage devices.




BD Live
Now you can tap into live chats, trivia games and newly developed content right from your Network Blu-ray Disc Player. Coupled with a high-speed Internet connection, BD Live allows you to take advantage of interactive experiences, exclusive downloads and tons of extra features.




What's in the Box
LG BD390 Unit, Remote Control, Owner's Manual



REVIEW FROM HOME THEATER MAGAZINE


REVIEW FROM HOMETHEATERMAG.COM: LG BD390
Thankfully, with the format war behind us, manufacturers can concentrate on making great Blu-ray players, and LG hasn't stopped its innovation. It was the first to release a BD player with Netflix streaming (BD300) and has upped the ante with its latest player by adding YouTube, CinemaNow, and 802.11n Wi-Fi. Read the full review at HomeTheaterMag.com.
